decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy and buff Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The deck includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, as well as supportive cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The Eldrazi Temple helps to reduce the mana cost of Eldrazi creatures, allowing for explosive plays early in the game. Wasteland and Glaring Fleshraker provide additional disruption, while the deck's mana base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Caves of Chaos Adventurer, supported by mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Trinisphere while maintaining pressure with efficient beaters. Wasteland helps to control the opponent's mana base, and Anointed Peacekeeper provides additional protection. The deck also includes some card draw with Once Upon a Time and Witch Enchanter, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats. It uses cheap interaction like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Fatal Push to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and selection, while Murktide Regent and other threats like Orcish Bowmaster and Barrowgoyf close out the game quickly. The deck also includes some powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Brazen Borrower to give it versatility in different matchups.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's hand. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to generate advantage and apply pressure. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and ways to protect its creatures, this deck aims to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of land disruption cards like Wasteland adds another layer of disruption to keep the opponent off balance.

The deck focuses on using disruptive spells such as Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the opponent's hand while deploying efficient threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. The selection of planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student adds card advantage and additional utility to the deck. The mana base consists of a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient threats. The deck utilizes cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, Daze, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent, while also playing powerful threats like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, Murktide Regent, and Brazen Borrower to close out the game quickly. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game, forcing the opponent onto the back foot while maintaining a strong board presence. It excels at adapting to different matchups and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through manipulation of lands and powerful control spells. By utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful token creatures, backed up by disruption spells like Crop Rotation and Wasteland, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while building up its own board state. With access to strong control elements like Karakas and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, the deck can outmaneuver opponents and grind out a win through attrition.

The deck aims to quickly cycle through spells to put all of its creatures in the graveyard, then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for a win. The key concept relies on speed and efficiency in casting spells to set up the game-winning combo. The deck includes various ways to generate mana, protect the combo with counterspells, and dig through the deck quickly to find the necessary pieces. It requires careful sequencing and timing to execute the combo successfully and defeat the opponent before they can stop it.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent to apply pressure. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with opposing creatures. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, further slowing them down. The goal is to control the game tempo and win through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Lotus Petal to search for and accelerate this combo. Pithing Needle and Duress are included to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Vampire Hexmage and Not of This World are used to protect your combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently assemble the combo and win the game through a powerful, hard-to-answer threat.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of powerful control spells and card advantage engines to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the game. The deck features a mix of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Leyline Binding. Card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder help find key pieces, while threats like Quantum Riddler and Murktide Regent provide win conditions. The deck also includes land disruption with Wasteland and utility lands like Karakas for additional control options.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly control the board through disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while also utilizing efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Barrowgoyf to close out the game as fast as possible. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure, utilizing cards like Daze and Force of Will to protect key threats. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle by deploying a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes cards that provide additional value and disruption, such as Karakas and Goblin Bombardment. Additionally, there is a strong emphasis on mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Static Prison to hinder opponents' game plans. The deck aims to close out games swiftly through a combination of creature combat and direct damage from cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah.

The deck revolves around assembling the "Grindstone" and "Painter's Servant" combo to mill the opponent's deck. It utilizes cards like "Goblin Engineer" and "Goblin Welder" to tutor and recur combo pieces, while disrupting opponent's plays with cards like "Pyroblast" and "Red Elemental Blast". Additionally, cards like "Ancient Tomb" and "Lotus Petal" allow for fast mana acceleration to set up the combo quickly. Overall, the deck aims to control the board, disrupt opponent's strategies, and win through the combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to use the card Doomsday to assemble a winning combination of cards and win the game in a single turn. The deck includes efficient spells like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, alongside disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. Thassa's Oracle serves as the win condition by putting the top card of the library into the graveyard. The deck focuses on tutoring for key pieces and carefully sequencing actions to set up the Doomsday combo for victory.

The main focus of this Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them through efficient and disruptive creatures like Barrowgoyf and Murktide Regent. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Daze to disrupt the opponent's hand and tempo, while also protecting our own game plan with cards like Force of Will and Fatal Push. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Snuff Out and Orcish Bowmasters, while ensuring card advantage with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and filtering through the deck with Brainstorm and Ponder.
